72141391.review:
Reventure is the kind of game you binge in one or two nights and then remember pleasantly, filled with fun references, a simple storyline and a "do whatever you want" style from the start that can be a little intimidating at first, but that with each final you unlock gets more and more easy to grasp and master. 
The gameplay at it's core its extreamly simplistic and it's just a facilitator to get to see the different finals, which, at first, are extreamly easy and intuitive to get but get grindy and a harder as the number goes up. Getting the 100 finals is VERY satisfying and it actually kinda wraps things up pretty well if you get them in order, and i've yet to play the extra gameplay after the 100th final, so I cannot comment on that yet. 
Another thing to note is that one would think that the game gets repetitive after a while, after all, it's the same map, the same npcs and the same storyline each time, but each final leaves it's mark on the map or on the player, making it a surprisingly diverse adventure from start to finish (the size and complexity of the map helps with that too, I've yet to fully understand the layout and ALL the secret tunnels and passages from one location to another). 
In terms of art, the graphics are just your good ol' 8 bit adventure with 4x4 pixel faces, but that matches up the "adventure kingdom" aesthetic surprinsingly well. Good music that doesn't get anoying even while being the same 5-6 songs over and over again, and a pretty fun story with intelligent and witty writing.
Now, on the donwsides, it can be really easy to get stuck because some endings rely on the player interacting in slighty different ways with the same npcs to the point where you're not sure if you've tried every interaction with every single npc and that can be a little taxing. Also the game doesn't explain anything, it expects the player to figure how everything works by themselves (wich you may expect, involves a lot of trial and error), this is not always a bad thing to some players who enjoy the challenge but for more casual people it can be a bit irritating wasting some time conducting experiments to see what works and what doesn't with the high amount of moving pieces the game has. Lastly, and in my own opinion, some of the "longer" finals felt a bit underwhelming after going through a lot to understand how to get them, as in, I would've liked bigger implications with getting certain finals whereas it felt like going through some trouble just to get a steam achievement.
All in all, fun experience, props to the devs for doing something fun and unique and recomended to anyone with 7-9 hours to just play a fun indie adventure game. 7/10

71822058.review:
Reventure is a game in which Tim (you) try and save The Princess from The Dark Lord. There are many different endings to this game, with the game "restarting" after each enging. Restart is in quotes because the map changes slightly after different endings. 
[h1] What I Liked [/h1]
First of all, this game is pretty, The art style is cute and sort of retro. Also, after most endings, the player sprite/name may change. For example, Tim might drown in one ending, and in the next run you play as his son, Tim Jr, rocking a smaller version of the Tim sprite. Aside from the art style, the gameplay is also very fun. The gameplay loop goes like: "Choose what gear to get around the map, Visit one of the many locations of the map, discover something you didn't see before, ending, repeat". This gameplay may not be for everyone, but I personally loved it. It is so satisfying to plan a run and reach the ending you wanted to. Speaking of the endings, each one has individually written splash text describing your demise. This works really well. I mean, really well. The humor of this game is definitely one of it's strong sides, from funny dialogue to elaborate jokes across multiple runs. Another great part of this game is just how many options you have. If you find an item, and have a crazy idea of what to do with it, try it, because it is 99% of the time going to be an ending. For example, eventually in the game you get an item that lets you hug things. Yep, you can hug pretty much [i] anything[/i]. Also, it isnt like after you reach an ending, the map resets. For example, if you fall to your death, in future runs, blood can be seen at the point where you hit the ground. Despite all these positives, there are some negatives, however.
[h1] What I Didn't Like [/h1]
As far as negatives go, I think they are few and far between. For one, there are many endings that involve "doing everything for X ending, but change one thing at the end for Y ending". There aren't many of these, so it isn't a very big issue though. As I mentioned earlier in this review, this style of game definitely isn't for everyone, and i'm sure many will find the gameplay repetitive, but I and many others loved this game, and I'm sure anyone who buys it will enjoy it too

71817548.review: I absolutely loved this game. It's fun, hilarious and entertaining. Many different outcomes, as the game's description says, so nothing repetitive. Overall, it's an amazing game, so go get it and try it out!

71235638.review:
Reventure isn't like other "your choices matter" type games. Some games would have about three endings with slight variation in each and call it a day, but not here. Every ending in this game felt interesting and even the multiple endings caused by going to the same place felt unique.

100 endings isn't the only thing this game offers, the art, music, and gameplay were all wonderful. The art and music make this world feel like any other adventure game but still differentiate themselves from the genre. The gameplay offered an interesting challenge when it came to getting more complicated endings, and even after getting all 100 endings there was still a nice bunch of fun post game content to complete

This is one of my favorite games and I hope it can be yours to.

71011074.review:
It's a "meh" kind of game, where I normally wouldn't bother reviewing one way or the other, but here's the thing that made me hate it. This is a "completionist" type of game, where you try to do literally everything there is to do in the game. This obviously attracts achievement type people. The game was finished, with 100 different endings, and by getting them all, you 100% the game itself. The problem is, now, months, if not years later, they added an extremely minimal amount of content, in the way of one "final" ending, #101. It's not simple to get, and requires you to be quite familiar with the game. But since I already beat the game a long time ago, and put it away, I don't remember it at all at this point, and there's no way I'm going to get back into the game, and memorize the whole map again, just to get that little one last bit. It's more annoying than anything. Adding content is great, cudos to the devs for continuing their product when it's been released for such a long time, but to ruin everyone's 100% completion of the game, just for that tiny bit of content, and then making it annoying to get... It just makes me hate everything about this game now. So know that, if you're planning on getting 100%, this is the type of dev that will ruin your completion of the game.

EDIT: I'm now actually trying to go for the last achievement, and it's absolute garbage. Definitely not worth returning to the game. It seems part of it is literally walking around the ENTIRE MAP, cutting all the stupid grass... What is wrong with the devs here? They finish the game, then they add this garbage, making you hate the game?
